title: Familiarize Cyber Security in Enterprise environment (Italy)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
6 months

**Hours per week**
25

**Preferred start date**
From January 2025

*The organisation has indicated that the start and end dates are flexible.

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
Iuniperus srl

**Description of the tasks**
Information Security Management
Internship activities and objectives
Activity
Systematic control of environments to identify and record threats, weaknesses, non-compliance
Analysis of the company's critical assets to identify vulnerabilities to intrusions or attacks
Goals
RA1: Apply control protocols and address critical issues relating to the security of the information system, initiating the execution of recovery plans in the event of a crisis
Other activity not included in the Atlas of work and qualifications
Daily monitoring of the main Information Security channels (mailing lists, forums, etc.) in order to:
-detect the presence of new potentially impacting zero-day vulnerabilities or threats that could impact on IT assets under management and direct appropriate resolution interventions.

-creation of a mapping of the application stack for the provision of the services of interest, in order to build a Knowledge Base of the IT services useful for the subsequent definition of an automatic notification process of new vulnerabilities that require corrective interventions.

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
Ability to analyse and synthesise
Problem solving
Information management skills
Interpersonal skills
Teamwork
Critical and self-critical abilities
Ability to work in an interdisciplinary team
Ability to apply knowledge in practice
Ability to adapt to new situations
Concern for quality

**Host organisation support: logistic support**
Transportation, remote work options.

**Host organisation support: financial support**
Insurance.

**Host organisation support: mentoring conditions**
Daily, weekly.

**Additional requirements**
Not listed.

**Application process**
Evaluation of CV, Recommendation and motivation etters.
Interview.

**Field of studies**
Formal science  /  Computer science

**Level of studies**
Bachelor Year 3
Bachelor Year 4

title: FEA/CFD, Digital Twin and AI for industrial and biomed application (Italy)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
6 months

**Hours per week**
30

**Preferred start date**
From January 2025

*The organisation has indicated that the start and end dates are flexible.

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
ASTARTE

**Description of the tasks**
We are seeking a motivated and passionate intern with an interest in engineering simulations and artificial intelligence to join our R&D team. The intern will have the opportunity to contribute to industrial innovation projects aimed at supporting our customers in technological advancements for process and product improvement. Our work involves collaboration with internationally renowned partners and clients, encompassing both industrial and EU-funded projects. Key areas of focus include structural optimization, thermostructural optimization, combustion, fluid dynamics, and the development of digital technologies for the biomedical industry.

The tasks:
- Collaborate with the R&D team to develop and validate simulation models.
- Analyze and interpret simulation results to suggest design improvements.
- Develop AI-based tools and methods for optimizing system performance.
- Contribute to technical documentation and drafting scientific articles, with the possibility of publication.
- Interact with industrial clients to understand their needs and propose tailored solutions.

Work Environment:
We offer a dynamic and youthful work environment, with a strong focus on innovation and professional growth. This internship represents a unique opportunity to gain practical experience in a rapidly evolving field and to contribute to impactful projects.

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
Problem solving
Interpersonal skills
Teamwork
Critical and self-critical abilities
Ability to work in an interdisciplinary team
Ability to apply knowledge in practice
Ability to adapt to new situations
Concern for quality
Ability to generate new ideas (creativity)
Ability to work autonomously

**Host organisation support: logistic support**
We offer dedicated office space and the necessary computer equipment to carry out research and development tasks efficiently. 

**Host organisation support: financial support**
To be evaluated as needed.

**Host organisation support: mentoring conditions**
Interns will have daily contact with a dedicated tutor to provide guidance, support, and ensure a productive learning experience.

**Additional requirements**
Not listed.

**Application process**
Candidates interested in applying for this internship should follow these steps:

1. Resume and cover letter submission: send your updated resume and a cover letter detailing your interest in the position, relevant skills, and any experience related to FEA, CFD, or AI.

2. Initial screening: we will review all applications and select candidates for an initial screening interview. This interview will assess your qualifications and suitability for the role.

3. Technical and motivational interview: candidates who pass the initial screening will be invited for a technical interview. This interview will focus on your technical knowledge and skills relevant to the internship, including motivation and expectations. This is also an opportunity to ask questions about the internship.

4. Offer and onboarding: successful candidates will receive an offer, followed by an onboarding process that includes orientation, assignment of a dedicated tutor, and setup of workspaces and equipment.

**Field of studies**
Applied science  /  Engineering and technology

**Level of studies**
Bachelor Year 4

title: Production Company (Italy)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
5 months

**Hours per week**
24

**Preferred start date**
From January 2025

*The organisation has indicated that the start and end dates are flexible.

**Further information about host organisation and NICAL FILMS SRL is an independent film company born in Cagliari 2019, managed by
Nicola Mennuni and Alessandra Usai. We develop and produce documentaries, short films
and feature film. We produce hight quality project with special attention on historical, biopic
and art content. www.nicalfilms.com
Besides producing documentaries, commercials, short films and corporate content, due to
Sardinia becoming a thriving production location with extraordinary resources and unique
beauty, we also offer the following production services: Line production, Photography,
Concept development, Production management, Photo shoot management, Scriptwriting,
Storyboarding, Directing, Shooting, Location scouting, Set/Prop design, Casting,
Background talent, Local crew, Equipment, Styling, Hair & Make Up, Videography,
Facilities’ booking, Permits, Insurance, Lodging, Catering, Transportation, Budgeting &
Scheduling.
Languages: italian-english
Who we are
Nicola Mennuni is the producer and general manager while Alessandra Usai is a director
and Ceo.

TV Reality “Below

**Description of the tasks**
Internship Tasks at the Film and Documentary Production Company:

Assisting in Pre-Production Activities:

Researching and developing creative ideas for film and documentary projects.
Collaborating with the team in scriptwriting, storyboard creation, and project planning.
Assisting in location scouting and casting sessions.
Supporting Production Phase:

Assisting on set during film and documentary shoots.
Helping with equipment setup and management.
Observing and learning about directing, cinematography, and sound recording processes.
Involvement in Post-Production Tasks:

Assisting in editing footage, adding music, sound effects, and visual elements.
Learning about the post-production workflow and software used in the industry.
Providing creative input and feedback during the editing process.
Participating in Distribution and Promotion:

Contributing to marketing strategies for film and documentary releases.
Assisting in organizing screenings, film festivals entries, and promotional events.
Learning about the distribution channels and strategies in the film industry.
Administrative and Operational Support:

Assisting with administrative tasks such as budget tracking, scheduling, and coordination.
Learning about the legal and contractual aspects of film production.
Supporting the team in day-to-day operational activities within the production company.
This internship will offer hands-on experience in various aspects of film and documentary production, providing valuable insights into the industry and opportunities for professional growth.

We have projects in different stages .. mainly in post production but one would start at the end of the year so this internship will offer the opportunity to understand different activity and professional sectors.

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
Ability to analyse and synthesise
Problem solving
Ability in organising and planning
Teamwork
Ability to work in an interdisciplinary team
Ability to generate new ideas (creativity)
Understanding of cultures and customs of other countries
Ability to work autonomously
Ability to learn
Ability to adapt to new situations

**Host organisation support: logistic support**
Dedicated office and forniture, ( remote work option as well).

**Host organisation support: financial support**
Bonus (depends).

**Host organisation support: mentoring conditions**
Twice per week.

**Additional requirements**
Curiosity and keen to learn.

**Application process**
We can meet in Cagliari for a final interview or we can arrange an online call in case we are not physical in Cagliari. 

**Field of studies**
Humanities  /  Visual arts

**Level of studies**
Bachelor Year 1
Bachelor Year 2
Bachelor Year 3
Master's Year 1
Master's Year 2
Bachelor Year 4

description:
**Duration of the internship**
Between 2 and 6 months

**Hours per week**
20-40

**Preferred start date**
From January 2025

*The organisation has indicated that the start and end dates are flexible.

**Further information about host organisation and NICAL Advantage Analysis

**Description of the tasks**
We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Stocks Trader to join our trading team. As a Stocks Trader, you will be responsible for executing trades in equities markets, analyzing market trends and news, and managing risks associated with trading activities. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of equities markets, experience in executing trades.

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, or a related field

Deep understanding of equities markets and trading strategies

Experience in executing trades in equities markets

Strong analytical skills and attention to detail

Ability to work under pressure and make informed decisions quickly

Proficiency in trading platforms and other relevant trading technology

Python / R

If you are a highly motivated and experienced Stocks Trader with a passion for equities markets and trading, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

**Additional requirements**
Python / R

**Application process**
Not listed

**Field of studies**
Finance, economics, a related field or IT

**Level of studies**
Bachelor level 1
Bachelor level 2

Bachelor level 4

title: Organise and promote International events with EDUC (France)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
4 to 6 months

**Hours per week**
35h

**Preferred start date**
February 2025

**Preferred end date**
July 2025

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
The International Affairs Department of the University of Rennes is made of an international team of 23 administrative staff. The Department is located in a modern and central building in the city of Rennes. Rennes is the capital city of the Brittany Region, in the west part of France. Just 1.5h by train from Paris and 1h from the seaside. Rennes is a vibrant city, with plenty of sports and cultural activities to do.

**Description of the tasks**
Are you passionate about communications and event organisation and want to gain practical experience in this field? 

We are looking for a motivated, inquisitive intern with good interpersonal skills to help the EDUC team organise a number of events aimed at higher education professionals in the EDUC alliance network (teachers, researchers, administrative staff, etc.), as well as students. 

- Participation in the planning and preparation of events 
- Logistical and administrative support (organisation of venues, catering, list of participants, etc.) 
- Support the Communication Officer in creating content for events: articles, posts, etc. 
- Help to produce presentation and promotional materials (posters, photo reports, etc.) 
- Support the team on other ad hoc assignments 

Profile required 

- Student in communications, events management, marketing or a similar field. 
- To be at ease with photo and video tools (production and post-production), and familiar with social media norms. 
- Organised, rigorous and keen to work as part of a team. 
- autonomous and pro-active 
- Good written and oral communication skills. 
- Creativity and initiative 
- Good command of office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Canva).

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
Interpersonal skills  
Ability in organising and planning  
Ability to work in an interdisciplinary team.

title: Comparative Study of Student Professions and Tutoring in Universities (France)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
3 to 6 months 
	
Option 1 - 3 to 6 months: this period would enable the trainee to collect data from the partner universities in the EDUC project, analyse the different practices in terms of tutoring and other student jobs, and write a detailed report with recommendations for your university. 

Option 2 - 6 months: this period would enable the trainee to carry out an in-depth analysis, with time for making contact and coordinating with several international universities, as well as making detailed comparisons. 

Option 3 - 3 months: this would be appropriate if the benchmark is more general, with a focus on the broad outlines of the practices observed.

**Hours per week**
37.5

**Preferred start date**
06.01.2025

**Preferred end date**
06.06.2025

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
UNIVERSITE DE RENNES

**Description of the tasks**
SUPTICE's Student Success Unit is looking for a trainee to carry out a comparative study of student jobs at university, with a particular focus on tutoring. Tutoring, a peer support system, plays a key role in student success by facilitating student integration and learning. We are particularly interested in the impact of tutoring and its various forms in universities, including distance tutoring arrangements, which enable students to be supported in a flexible way that is adapted to new ways of learning.  

This benchmark will include an international dimension by exploring the practices of the EDUC Alliance partner universities. 

Tasks to be carried out by the trainee:
Documentary research: Collect and analyse documentation on tutoring practices and other student professions in French and international universities.
Drawing up an inventory: Drawing up an inventory of the tutoring arrangements in place in the EDUC Alliance partner universities, including forms of distance tutoring.
Interviews and surveys: Conducting interviews with key players (students, tutors, teachers, educational managers) to gather qualitative data.
Comparative analysis: Comparing tutoring practices and student careers in different universities (formats, impact, organisation).
Drawing up a report: Presenting a full analysis of the results, with recommendations for improving the arrangements in place within our university.
Proposals for best practice: Identify levers for improvement and best practice based on an analysis of the various international experiences.
Presentation of results: Organise a presentation or summary report of the findings for the Student Success Unit team and the departments concerned.
The aim of this placement is to contribute to the development of the Student Success Unit's activities by providing an in-depth analysis of current practices and identifying ways of improving the existing systems within our university.

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
Ability to analyse and summarise: to process the data collected and compare university practices. 
Problem solving: to identify areas for improvement and propose solutions tailored to the needs identified. 
Information management skills: to organise information from different sources (universities, reports, surveys).
Organisational and planning skills: to complete the project on time, respecting the various stages of the benchmark. 
Ability to apply knowledge in practice: to transform theoretical analysis into practical recommendations and concrete actions for the Student Success Centre.

**Host organisation support: logistic support**
https://cmi.univ-rennes.fr/en/housing

**Host organisation support: financial support**
Allowance of €4.35 per hour

**Host organisation support: mentoring conditions**
1 meeting per week with the supervisors

**Additional requirements**
None

**Application process**
Not listed

**Field of studies**
Interdisciplinary / Multidisciplinary: The approach to the course involves combining several fields (education, management, internationalisation). 
Applied Science / Education: This is the central discipline as it involves analysing teaching practices, particularly tutoring. 
Applied Science / Business and Management: Relevant for understanding the organisation and management of student jobs and the implementation of tutoring systems. 
Applied Science / Communication, Media Studies and Journalism: For analysing and promoting communication initiatives around schemes such as tutoring, particularly in an international context.

**Level of studies**
Master level 1
Master level 2

title: Create an online course in English! (France)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
2 months

**Hours per week**
35

**Preferred start date**
1 February 2025

**Preferred end date**
31 March 2025

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
UNIVERSITE DE RENNES. https://langues.univ-rennes.fr/en

**Description of the tasks**
Objective: To develop an online course for 3rd year medical students (those repeating the year), who have already passed their English course. The aim is to help them maintain and refine their English skills in preparation for the sixth-year critical reading of research articles exam.
1. Context and Goals
Third-year medical students repeating the year are no longer required to take English, despite the fact that the LCA exam in the sixth year necessitates ongoing practice. This internship will involve designing an online course that supports them in maintaining and strengthening their ability to critically engage with scientific English.
2. Structure of the Internship
•	Step 1:
o	Familiarization with the specific needs of medical students in relation to English and scientific research.
o	Getting familiar with what already exists on the Moodle platform for M3 students, to determine what extra content could be useful and get inspiration from already existing contents
o	Exploration of various tools and platforms suitable to integrate or for creating an online course (both synchronous and asynchronous formats).
o	Review of the key language skills required for understanding research English.
•	Step 2:
o	Development of the core content for the course, focusing on:
	Essential research vocabulary.
	Comparing the language used in popular science articles versus peer-reviewed scientific papers.
	How to break down and interpret complex titles and sentence structures.
	Methods for simplifying complex sentences to help improve comprehension.
o	Creation of interactive exercises, including video-based comprehension activities, where students watch researchers explain their work and answer related questions.
•	Step 3:
o	Development of engaging and interactive elements to make the sessions more dynamic and enjoyable (e.g., language games, group discussions).
o	Testing and refining the material with a small group of volunteer students.
o	Gathering feedback to then adjust and improve the course.
•	Step 4:
o	Finalization of the course content and preparation of self- assessment methods.
o	Internship report.
3. Expected Outcomes
•	An online course (either synchronous or asynchronous) designed to help students develop their critical reading skills in scientific English, tailored to their specific needs.
•	A set of interactive exercises, including video-based comprehension tasks and comparison of different types of scientific writing.
•	Engaging, simplified activities to help students grasp complex concepts.
•	Student feedback to help optimize the course.

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
•	Ability to analyse and synthesise 
•	Knowledge of a foreign language 
•	Ability to work autonomously 
•	Ability to generate new ideas (creativity)

**Host organisation support: logistic support**
•	Link on how to find an accomodation in Rennes 
•	Access to sports facilities on campus

**Host organisation support: financial support**
None

**Host organisation support: mentoring conditions**
•	Regular check-ins will be scheduled to ensure progress and to provide guidance.
•	The intern’s report writing will be supervised during the internship

**Additional requirements**
None

**Application process**
Not listed

**Field of studies**
Humanities  /  Language

**Level of studies**
Bachelor level 1
Bachelor level 2
Bachelor level 3
Bachelor level 4
Master level 1
Master level 2

title: Business training and support for companies (Italy)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
6 months

**Hours per week**
FROM 4-6 HOURS PER WEEK TO 6 HOURS PER DAY (30 HOURS PER WEEK)

**Preferred start date**
15/7/2024

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
MV Group & Partners
La nostra professione è dedita all’espansione sul mercato di riferimento, supportando i nostri clienti durante tutte le fasi necessarie all’insediamento in nuovi mercati.
LONDON | DUBLIN| DUBAI | ABU DHABI | ZURICH | MIAMI | LAS PALMAS | BALI

WWW.MVGLOBALCOMPANY.COM

**Description of the tasks**
SUPPORT WITH COMPANIES, ONBOARDING, CUSTOMER CONCIERGE, CONSULTANCY, SALES, MARKETING, BUSINESS COACHING.

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
Ability to work in an interdisciplinary team
Ethical commitment
Ability to analyse and synthesise
Problem solving
Interpersonal skills
Ability in organising and planning
Decision making
Teamwork
Ability to adapt to new situations
Ability to generate new ideas (creativity)


**Host organisation support: logistic support**
We have logistical support
Transportation, concierge on food and accommodation, remote work options

**Host organisation support: financial support**
Students can have
Allowance/salary, bonuses for portions of turnover that they bring into the company and demonstrate that they know how to manage them

**Host organisation support: mentoring conditions**
Our mentoring conditions are the most advantageous on the market, offering a frequency of meetings with the tutor of 2/3 times a week

**Additional requirements**
We are looking for passionate and curious people, eager to change their lives and the lives of others

**Application process**
1. First Selection - Presentation and Questions

In the first phase, we invite you to discover the essence of MV Group by accessing an initial area. Here, you will have the opportunity to learn about our values, our code of ethics and understand who we are looking to join our team. We will also explain how the selection steps work.

2. Second Selection - Deepening the Partnership

In the second step, we will ask you to identify which element is missing to strengthen your piece of partnership with us. Through a field test and an innovative approach, we will challenge you to think laterally, providing you with contract information and requiring you to sign a non-disclosure agreement (NDA).

3. Third Selection - Group Test
Subsequently, you will take a group test to evaluate your collaboration skills and your contribution to the team in practical situations.

4. Fourth Selection - Closure of the Contract
The next stage involves closing the contract to selected couples, where we will further discuss the details and conditions of the partnership.

5. Inclusion in the Team - Telegram Groups and Flow
Once you join the team, we will integrate you into dedicated Telegram groups to facilitate communication and information flow.

6. Weekly Meetings - Setting Roles and Processes
You will participate in weekly meetings that will outline the roles, skills, business processes, tools used, our Vivid Vision and company behavior regulations.

7. Live Team Building Events
Finally, you will have the opportunity to participate in live team building events, where you can connect with the team and deepen professional and personal bonds.

This selection and integration path is designed to identify talented, collaborative individuals in line with the values ​​of MV Group, while offering an engaging and constructive experience for those who wish to be part of our team

**Field of studies**
Humanities  /  Language

**Level of studies**
Bachelor Year 1
Bachelor Year 2
Bachelor Year 3
Bachelor Year 4
Master's Year 1
Master's Year 2

title: Spanish Assistant (Spain)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
6 months

**Hours per week**
30-40

**Preferred start date**
7/1/2025

**Preferred end date**
7/7/2025

*The organisation has indicated that the start and end dates are flexible. The organisation can accept also accept interns in summer.

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
PROYECTO ESPAÑOL consists of four schools specialised in Spanish as a foreign language with headquarters in the most touristy cities, such as Alicante or Granada and with collaborators in Barcelona and Madrid.
Our aim is simple: combine teaching Spanish with experiences beyond the classroom, achieving total immersion in history, culture and social life. 

**Description of the tasks**
- Supplementary Spanish lessons to our foreign students learning Spanish.
- Organization of the conversation exchange with International students.
- Produce supplementary teaching materials and participate in classes as required.
- Coordinate some extra activities with the Students out of class.
- Schedule and coordinate speaking engagements, appearances, photo shoots, and other special events.
- Support of the Spanish back office Department (students and teachers) and Front desk as required.
- Greet students.
- Assist in the distribution or delivery of marketing materials.
- Provide support to social media efforts.
- Create or update databases.

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
Problem solving
Interpersonal skills
Ability in organising and planning
Oral and written communication in the native language
Elementary computer skills
Decision making
Teamwork
Knowledge of a foreign language
Ability to learn
Will to succeed

**Host organisation support: logistic support**
Special price for accommodation. German/English course offered by the company

**Host organisation support: financial support**
This is a non-paid internship. 

**Host organisation support: mentoring conditions**
Monthly mentoring

**Additional requirements**
None

Not listed
